Paper: SmartDIMM: In-Memory Acceleration of Upper Layer Protocols
Methodology: FPGA implementation using AxDIMM, a DIMM-based near memory processing product from Samsung. Also used emulation approach
Authors: N. Patel, A. Mamandipoor, M. Nouri, M. Alian
Name: SmartDIMM

Paper: StreamPIM: Streaming Matrix Computation in Racetrack Memory
Methodology: Replace existing main memory system in full system simulator like gem5 with RM latency model derived from NVM modeling tools (RTSim and NVSim). From scratch cycle-accurate simulator to simulate PIM latency in RM.
Authors: Y. An, Y. Tang, S. Yi, L. Peng, X. Pan, G. Sun, Z. Luo, Q. Li, J. Zhang
Name: StreamPIM

Paper: Understanding Bulk-Bitwise Processing-In-Memory Through Database Analytics
Methodology: Evaluate PIMDB using gem5 full-system simulator.
Authors: Ben Perach, Ronny Ronen, Benny Kimelfeld, and Shahar Kvatinsky
Name: PIMDB

Paper: CHOPPER: A Compiler Infrastructure for Programmable Bit-serial SIMD Processing Using Memory in DRAM
Methodology: Gem5 with integrated Ramulator
Authors: X. Peng, Y. Wang, M. Yang
Name: CHOPPER

Paper: DIMM-Link: Enabling Efficient Inter-DIMM Communication for Near-Memory Processing
Methodology: FPGA prototype. Simulate DIMM-Link and baseline architectures using modified MultiPIM simulator developed on Zsim, Ramulator, and BookSim. CPU forwarding latency profiled using gem5.
Tools: BookSim, FPGA/Synthesis, MultiPIM, Ramulator, ZSim, gem5
Authors: Zhe Zhou, Cong Li, Fan Yang, and Guangyu Sun
Name: DIMM-Link

Paper: Accelerating Personalized Recommendation with Cross-level Near-Memory Processing
Methodology: Implement ReCross on modified Ramulator to evaluate performance and effectiveness. Subarray parallelism modeled by adjusting parts of DRAM timing constraints. Synthesize PEs using 40nm CMOS technology, area and power of PEs from Synopsys Design Compiler. DRAM energy of DDR5 from MICRON DDR4 power calculator. Off-chip I/O data from CACTI-IO
Tools: CACTI-IO, FPGA/Synthesis, Micron DRAM Power Calculator, Ramulator
Authors:
Haifeng Liu, Long Zheng, Yu Huang, Chaoqiang Liu, Xiangyu Ye, Jingrui
Yuan, Xiaofei Liao, Hai Jin, and Jingling Xue
Name: ReCross

Paper: MetaNMP: Leveraging Cartesian-Like Product to Accelerate HGNNs with Near-Memory Processing
Methodology: Evaluate MetaNMP performance using modified Ramulator and trace-driven Zsim. Generate traces by simulating HGNNs at behavioral level. Estimate cache area, energy consumption, access latency using Cacti. Area, energy consumption, latency of special hardware units evaluated using Synopsys Design Compiler. Cacti-3DD to evaluate DRAM energy consumption, Cacti-IO for energy consumption of off-chip I/O at DIMM-level.
Tools: CACTI, CACTI-3DD, CACTI-IO, Ramulator, Synopsys, ZSim
Authors: Dan Chen, Haiheng He, Hai Jin, Long Zheng, Yu Huang, Xinyang Shen, and Xiaofei Liao
Name: MetaNMP

Paper: Analysis of Conventional, Near-Memory, and In-Memory DNN Accelerators
Methodology: Extend Timeloop to model architectures with hardware values. Use 45nm model and CACTI for buffers.
Authors: T. Glint, C. Jha, M. Awasthi, J. Mekie

Paper: Evaluating Machine Learning Workloads on Memory-Centric Computing Systems
Methodology: Implement ML workloads on real-world PIM system (UPMEM)
Authors: J. Gomez-Luna, Y. Guo, S. Brocard, J. Legriel, R. Cimadomo, G. Oliveira, G. Singh, O. Mutlo

Paper: RAELLA: Reforming the Arithmetic for Efficient, Low-Resolution, and Low-Loss Analog PIM: No Retraining Required!
Methodology: Create RAELLA model using Accelergy/Timeloop. Model SRAM in CACTI. Model ISAAC DAC/crossbars using modified NeuroSim
Authors: T. Andrulis, J. Emer, V. Sze
Name: RAELLA

Paper: CORUSCANT: Fast Efficient Processing-in-Racetrack Memories
Methodology: Modified NVSim for DWM energy. Synthesized PIM logic. custom sensing circuit. System-level simulation including PIM acceleration using extended RTSim with cycle-level simulation model of CORUSCANT PIM memory
Authors: S. Ollivier, S. Longofono, P. Dutta, J. Hu, S. Bhanja, A. Jones
Name: CORUSCANT

Paper: PIMCloud: QoS-Aware Resource Management of Latency-Critical Applications in Clouds with Processing-in-Memory
Methodology: Modified ZSim
Authors: S. Chen, Y. Jiang, C. Delimitrou, J. Martinez
Name: PIMCloud

Paper: TransPIM: A Memory-based Acceleration via Software-Hardware Co-Design for Transformer
Methodology: Implement using Verilog and synthesize using Synopsys compiler. In-house simulator to model performance and energy characteristics for TransPIM and PIM baselines. Front-end uses TensorFlow interface which extracts workload formation for the simulation. Backend is modified Ramulator.
Authors: M. Zhou, W. Xu, J. Kang, T. Rosing
Name: TransPIM

Paper: Accelerating Graph Convolutional Networks Using Crossbar-based Processing-In-Memory Architectures
Methodology: Model on-chip microarchitectural behaviors by implementing on homegrown cycle-accurate simulator. Memory traces go to Ramulator to simulate off-chip access behaviors. CACTI 6.5 to model energy and area for all PE buffers. CU voltage buffer, current buffer, current reductor take Cadence-simulated results. Reductor controller implemented in Verilog, power consumption and area from RTL synthesis.
Tools: CACTI 6.5, Cadence Spectre, FPGA/Synthesis, In-house Simulator, Ramulator
Authors: Y. Huang, L. Zheng, P. Yao, Q. Wang, X. Liao, H. Jin, J. Xue
Name: ReFlip

Paper: MeNDA: A Near-Memory Multi-way Merge Solution for Sparse Transposition and Dataflows
Methodology: Model performance by designing cycle-accurate simulator and connect memory interface to Ramulator. Area and power estimations based on synthesis of model using Synopsys design compiler.
Authors: Siying Feng, Xin He, Kuan-Yu Chen, Liu Ke, Xuan Zhang, David Blaauw, Trevor Mudge, and Ronald Dreslinski
Name: MeNDA

Paper: To PIM or Not for Emerging General Purpose Processing in DDR Memory Systems
Methodology: Simulate BLIMP and BLIMP-V using riscvOVPsim (runtimes) and DRAMSim2 (time to access bank-level memory from bank-level-core)
Authors:
Alexandar Devic, Siddhartha Balakrishna Rai, Anand Sivasubramaniam,
Ameen Akel, Sean Eilert, and Justin Eno
Name: BLIMP-V

Paper: DIMMining: Pruning-Efficient and Parallel Graph Mining on Near-Memory-Computing
Methodology: Design behavior-level BCSR-based graph mining simulator, which also generates physical memory access trace. Build trace-based cache simulator to simulate cache behavior in DIMMining. Latency, area, power data of the cache from CACTI. Ramulator to generate cycle-level evaluation results of each DDR4 rank. DRAM energy data from DRAMPower. Estimate latency, area, and power using Synopsys Design Compiler with TSMC 65nm library, scale performance results to 32nm technology node.
Tools: CACTI, DRAMPower, In-house Simulator, Ramulator, Synopsys
Authors: Guohao Dai, Zhenhua Zhu, Tianyu Fu, Chiyue Wei, Bangyan Wang, Xiangyu Li, Yuan Xie, Huazhong Yang, and Yu Wang.
Name: DIMMining

Paper: A 1ynm 1.25V 8Gb, 16Gb/s/pin GDDR6-based Accelerator-in-Memory supporting 1TFLOPS MAC Operation and Various Activation Functions for Deep-Learning
Authors: S. Lee, K. Kim, S. Oh, J. Park, G. Hong, D. Ka, K. Hwang, J. Park, et. al
Name: AiM

Paper: RACER: Bit-Pipelined Processing Using Resistive Memory
Methodology: Model RACER at device, circuit, and architecture levels. Develop Verilog model of ReRAM cell. Synthesize CMOS domain components using Synopsis Design Compiler to estimate area, power, and critical path latency of components as well as delay and power models for wires. Evaluate microbenchmarks using RACER-sim (https://github.com/ARCANA-Research/RACER-Artifacts in-house simulator which models execution and data movement)
Authors: Minh S. Q. Truong, Eric Chen, Deanyone Su, Alexander Glass, Liting Shen, L. Richard Carley, James A. Bain, and Saugata Ghose.
Name: RACER

Paper: TRiM: Enhancing Processor-Memory Interfaces with Scalable Tensor Reduction in Memory
Methodology: Modified Ramulator to evaluate performance and energy consumption. Analyze power and area for NDP architectures by estimating power consumption of DDR5 DRAM with DDR4 datasheets from industry (Micron, Samsung) and off-chip I/O with CACTI. DRAM read power by scaling from https://scholar.google.com/scholar_url?url=https://dl.acm.org/doi/abs/10.1145/3123939.3124545&hl=en&sa=T&oi=gsr-r&ct=res&cd=0&d=456589981979722916&ei=lTWEZp_8OaOuy9YPp9CV6A4&scisig=AFWwaeY7Zc0goPfeUgTCa3vBHF7i. Synthesized IPR and NPR units using Synopsys Design Compiler then scaled result.
Tools: CACTI, FPGA/Synthesis, Micron DRAM Power Calculator, Ramulator
Authors: Jaehyun Park, Byeongho Kim, Sungmin Yun, Eojin Lee, Minsoo Rhu, and Jung Ho Ahn.
Name: TRiM

Paper: GIRAF: General Purpose In- Storage Resistive Associative Framework
Authors: L. Yavits, R. Kaplan, R. Ginosar
Name: GIRAF

Paper: PiDRAM: A Holistic End-to- end FPGA-based Framework for Processing-in-DRAM
Methodology: Verilog/FPGA
Authors: A. Olgun, J. Gomez-Luna, K. Kanellopoulos, B. Salami,  ́ H. Hassan, O. Ergin, O. Mutlu
Name: PiDRAM

Paper: SIMDRAM: A Framework for Bit-Serial SIMD Processing Using DRAM
Authors: N. Hajinazar, G. F. Oliveira, S. Gregorio, J. D. Ferreira, N. M. Ghiasi, M. Patel, M. Alser, S. Ghose, J. Gomez-Luna, O. Mutlu

Paper: Accelerating Weather Prediction using Near-Memory Reconfigurable Fabric
Methodology: Evaluate accelerator designs on two FPGAs. AMESTER tool to measure active power consumption
Authors: G. Singh, D. Diamantopoulos, J. Gomez-Luna, C. Hagleitner, ´ S. Stuijk, H. Corporaal, O. Mutlu
Name: NERO

Paper: FPGA-based Near-memory Acceleration of Modern Data-intensive Applications
Methodology: FPGA
Authors: G. Singh, M. Alser, D. S. Cali, D. Diamantopoulos, J. Gomez- ´ Luna, H. Corporaal, O. Mutlu

Paper:
Google Neural Network Models for Edge Devices: Analyzing and Mitigating Machine
Learning Inference Bottlenecks
Methodology: looked at performance and energy using Edge TPU as baseline accelerator
Authors: A. Boroumand, S. Ghose, B. Akin, R. Narayanaswami, G. F. Oliveira, X. Ma, E. Shiu, O. Mutlu
Name: Mensa

Paper: MOUSE: Inference in Non-volatile Memory for Energy Harvesting Applications
Methodology: Simulate benchmarks on MOUSE with in-house simulator. Latency and energy cost due to peripheral circuitry using data from NVSim
Authors: S. Resch, S. Khatamifard, Z. Chowdhury, M. Zabihi, Z. Zhao, H. Cilasun, J. Wang, S. Sapatnekar, U. Karpuzcu
Name: MOUSE

Paper: ELP2IM: Efficient and Low Power Bitwise Operation Processing in DRAM
Methodology: H-spice for circuit-level simulation. Parameters from Rambus power model. Power consumption from spice simulation and Micron DDR3 DRAM power datasheet. In-house simulator to calculate latency, throughput, power consumption on several applications
Tools: HSPICE, In-house Simulator, Micron DRAM Power Calculator, Rambus power model, SPICE
Authors: X. Xin, Y. Zhang, J. Yang
Name: ELP2IM

Paper: NoM: Network- on-Memory for Inter-Bank Data Transfer in Highly-Banked Memories
Methodology: Evaluate effectiveness using Ramulator. Measure performance using IPC. Circuit-level / memory timing parameters from DDR3 DRAM (Micron). Evaluate energy consumption using DRAMPower simulator and Micron 3D energy model.
Tools: DRAMPower, Micron DRAM Power Calculator, Ramulator
Authors: S. H. S. Rezaei, M. Modarressi, R. Ausavarungnirun, M. Sadrosadati, O. Mutlu, M. Daneshtalab
Name: NoM

Paper: FIGARO: Improving System Performance via Fine-Grained In-DRAM Data Relocation and Caching
Methodology: Evaluate using modified Ramulator together with in-house processor simulator. User-level application traces from Pin. Fast subarray design using LISA’s SPICE model. Evaluate energy consumption using McPAT for CPU cores, CACTI 6.5 for caches, Orion 3.0 for the interconnect, modified DRAMPower for DRAM.
Tools: CACTI 6.5, DRAMPower, In-house Simulator, McPAT, Orion, Pin, Ramulator, SPICE
Authors: Y. Wang, L. Orosa, X. Peng, Y. Guo, S. Ghose, M. Patel, J. S. Kim, J. G. Luna, M. Sadrosadati, N. M. Ghiasi, et al.
Name: FIGARO/FIGCache

Paper: In-DRAM Bulk Bitwise Execution Engine
Methodology: [ambit methodology]
Authors: V. Seshadri, O. Mutlu

Paper: A Heterogeneous PIM Hardware-Software Co-Design for EnergyEfficient Graph Processing
Methodology: Implement cycle-accurate simulator. DRAMSim2 to simulate DRAM layer. PU modeled using PrimeTime, RFU simulated with NVSim. CACTI 6.5 to model buffers and estimate area, power, latency. On-chip-network modeled with Booksim 2.0
Tools: BookSim, CACTI 6.5, DRAMSim2, In-house Simulator, NVSim, PrimeTime
Authors: Y. Huang, L. Zheng, P. Yao, J. Zhao, X. Liao, H. Jin, J. Xue
Name: Hetraph

Paper: NERO: A Near HighBandwidth Memory Stencil Accelerator for Weather Prediction Modeling
Authors: G. Singh, D. Diamantopoulos, C. Hagleitner, J. Gomez-Luna, S. Stuijk, O. Mutlu, H. Corporaal
Name: NERO

Paper: NATSA: A Near-Data Processing Accelerator for Time Series Analysis
Methodology: Simulate general purpose cores using in-house integration of ZSim, whose front-end is Pin, with Ramulator. McPAT for power estimations. For NATSA accelerator, use gem5 and Aladdin integration. Power consumption of memory system using Micron Power Calculator.
Tools: Aladdin, McPAT, Micron DRAM Power Calculator, Pin, Ramulator, ZSim, gem5
Authors: I. Fernandez, R. Quislant, C. Giannoula, M. Alser, J. GomezLuna, E. Gutierrez, O. Plata, O. Mutlu
Name: NATSA

Paper: GenASM: A High-Performance, LowPower Approximate String Matching Acceleration Framework for Genome Sequence Analysis
Methodology: performance and power analysis using in-house simulator parametrized with synthesis and memory estimations (from compilers)
Authors: D. S. Cali, G. S. Kalsi, Z. Bingol, C. Firtina, L. Subramanian, J. S. Kim, R. Ausavarungnirun, M. Alser, J. Gomez-Luna, A. Boroumand, et al.
Name: GenASM

Paper: CONCEPT: A Column-Oriented Memory Controller for Efficient Memory and PIM Operations in RRAM
Methodology: Estimate array-level latency and energy of read, write, and MAGIC operations using SPICE. NVSim to determine latency and energy of peripheral circuit. Evaluate memory operations using NVMain. SniperSim for main memory traces. Evaluate PIM operations using bitmap indices. In-house simulator to compare performance and model latency of PIM operations and data transfer between CPU and main memory.
Tools: In-house Simulator, NVMain, NVSim, SPICE, Sniper
Authors: N. Talati, R. Ronen, H. Ha, S. Kvatinsky, B. Perach
Name: CONCEPT

Paper: FloatPIM: In-Memory Acceleration of Deep Neural Network Training with High Precision
Methodology: Cycle-accurate simulator based on Tensorflow to emulate memory functionality. HSPICE for accelerator circuit-level simulations to measure energy consumption and performance of operations, cross-validated using NVsim. System Verilog and Synopsys Design Compiler to implement and synthesize controller.
Tools: FPGA/Synthesis, HSPICE, In-house Simulator, NVSim, TensorFlow
Authors: Mohsen Imani, Saransh Gupta, Yeseong Kim, and Tajana Rosing.
Name: FloatPIM

Paper: PUMA: A Programmable Ultra- Efficient Memristor-Based Accelerator for Machine Learning Inference
Methodology: Implemented a detailed architectural simulator (PUMAsim) to evaluate performance and energy consumption. Datapath designed at RTL in Verilog HTL and mapped to IBM tech using Synopsys Design Compiler which was used to measure area and power consumption. Those area and power numbers added to PUMAsim for system-level workload evaluation. Memory modules modeled in Cacti 6.0 for area, power, latency. On-chip network modeled in cycle-level Booksim 2.0 interconnection network simulator, Orion 3.0 for energy and area models. Chip-to-chip interconnect model similar to DaDianNao’s. MVMU power and area models adapted from ISAAC.
Tools: BookSim, CACTI 6.5, FPGA/Synthesis, In-house Simulator, Orion
Authors: A. Ankit, I. E. Hajj, S. R. Chalamalasetti, G. Ndu, M. Foltin, R. S. Williams, P. Faraboschi, W.-m. W. Hwu, J. P. Strachan, K. Roy, D. S. Milojicic
Name: PUMA

Paper: AlignS: A Processing-in- Memory Accelerator for DNA Short Read Alignment Leveraging SOT-MRAM
Methodology: Comprehensive device-to-architecture evaluation along with two in-house simulators. NEGF and LLG with spin Hall effect equations to model SOT-MRAM bit-cell. Circuit-level simulation: Verilog-A model developed to co-simulate with interface CMOS circuits in Cadence Spectre and SPICE. Architectural-level simulator built based on NVSim. Controllers and add-on circuits synthesized by Design Compiler. Behavior-level simulator developed in Matlab.
Tools: Cadence Spectre, In-house Simulator, NVSim, SPICE, Verilog-A
Authors: S. Angizi, J. Sun, W. Zhang, D. Fan
Name: AlignS

Paper: Duality Cache for Data Parallel Acceleration
Methodology: Energy and power model from Neural Cache. Synthesize controller and state machine using Synopsis Design Compiler. CACTI to model energy and area for SRAM
Authors: D. Fujiki, S. Mahlke, R. Das
Name: Duality Cache

Paper: The Processing-in-Memory Paradigm: Mechanisms to Enable Adoption
Methodology: IMPICA: gem5 full-system simulator with DRAMSim2. McPAT for energy consumption of CPU, caches, memory controllers, IMPICA. DRAMSim2 for DRAM energy. LazyPIM: modified gem5, DRAMSim2 for DRAM timing.
Journal/Conference: Beyond-CMOS Technologies for Next Generation Computer Design
Authors: S. Ghose, K. Hsieh, A. Boroumand, R. Ausavarungnirun, O. Mutlu
Name: IMPICA, LazyPIM

Paper: ComputeDRAM: In- Memory Compute Using Off-the-Shelf DRAMs
Methodology: Evaluate work on set of testbeds (host system and FPGA board)
Authors: F. Gao, G. Tziantzioulis, D. Wentzlaff
Name: ComputeDRAM

Paper: GraphQ: Scalable PIM-based Graph Processing
Methodology: Evaluate with zSim with inserted NOC layer between LLC and memory.
Authors: Y. Zhuo, C. Wang, M. Zhang, R. Wang, D. Niu, Y. Wang, X. Qian
Name: GraphQ

Paper: CoNDA: Efficient Cache Coherence Support for near-Data Accelerators
Methodology: Implement in gem5 simulator. Perform sims in full-system mode with x86 ISA, modify integrated DRAMSim2 DRAM timing simulator to model 3D HMC DRAM. Model coherence mechanisms with Ruby memory model in gem5. Estimate cache energy consumption using CACTI-P 6.5
Authors: A. Boroumand, S. Ghose, M. Patel, H. Hassan, B. Lucia, R. Ausavarungnirun, K. Hsieh, N. Hajinazar, K. T. Malladi, H. Zheng, O. Mutlu
Name: CoNDA

Paper: NAPEL: Near-memory Computing Application Performance Prediction via Ensemble Learning
Methodology: Evaluate performance on real system and NMC performance on Ramulator, extended with 3D-stacked memory model.
Authors: G. Singh, J. Gomez-Luna, G. Mariani, G. F. Oliveira, S. Corda, S. Stujik, O. Mutlu, H. Corporaal
Name: NAPEL

Paper: Memristive Devices for Computation-in-Memory
Methodology: HSPICE simulation
Authors: J. Yu, H. A. D. Nguyen, L. Xie, et al.

Paper: CMP-PIM: An Energy-efficient Comparator-based Processing-in-Memory Neural Network Accelerator
Methodology: Evaluate performance of algorithm accuracy and hardware implementation using data-sets. Simulation on Torch, a Matlab-like deep learning framework. Circuit-level simulation initially in Cadence Spectre. ‘Massively modified’ NVSim to simulate real-time resistance in memory read/write paths. Control unit Verilog/Synopsys Design Compiler
Authors: S. Angizi, A. S. Rakin, D. Fan
Name: CMP-PIM/CMPNET

Paper: PIMA-Logic: A Novel Processing-in- Memory Architecture for Highly Flexible and Energy-efficient Logic Computation
Methodology: Simulation in Cadence Spectre. Logic netlist fed to ThrEshold Logic Synthesizer to obtain synthesized logic networks, which are mapped to PIMA-Logic. Evaluate performance for data encryption application using gem5, power dissipation from McPAT.
Authors: S. Angizi, Z. He, D. Fan
Name: PIMA-Logic

Paper: Neural Cache: Bit-serial In-cache Acceleration of Deep Neural Networks
Methodology: Power and delay of SRAM using simulated SPICE model. Developed cycle-accurate simulator for in-cache computation
Authors: C. Eckert, X. Wang, J. Wang, A. Subramaniyan, R. Iyer, D. Sylvester, D. Blaaauw, R. Das
Name: Neural Cache

Paper: DrAcc: a DRAM Based Accelerator for Accurate CNN Inference
Methodology: Design Compiler and H-spice for hardware simulation, CACTI to simulate DRAM structure

Authors: S. Ghose, K. Hsieh, A. Boroumand, R. Ausavarung- nirun, O. Mutlu

Paper: Scope: A Stochastic Computing Engine for DRAM-based In-situ Accelerator
Methodology: Evaluate circuit using heavily-modified CACTI-3DD to model DRAM architecture. FreePDK45 for computational unit parameters. Synthesize unit for power, performance, area parameters.
Authors: S. Li, A. O. Glova, X. Hu, P. Gu, D. Niu, K. T. Malladi, H. Zheng, B. Brennan, Y. Xie
Name: SCOPE

Paper: GraphP: Reducing Communication for PIM-based Graph Processing with Efficient Data Partition
Methodology: Build HMC simulator called hmc-zSim. Estimate unit energy cost with ORION 3.0. McPAT to check power results.
Authors: M. Zhang, Y. Zhuo, C. Wang, M. Gao, Y. Wu, K. Chen, C. Kozyrakis, X. Qian

Methodology: In-house simulator. Trace files of graph data access patterns from DynamoRIO. Apply to timing model from Cacti 6.5 and DRAMSim2 for execution time.

Methodology: full-system gem5 to implement coherence mechanism. DRAMSim2 within gem5 for DRAM timing. Energy with CACTI-P 6.5

Paper: Concurrent Data Structures for Near-Memory Computing

Authors: V. Seshadri

Paper: Buddy-RAM: Improving the Performance and Efficiency of Bulk Bitwise Operations Using DRAM

Authors: K. K. Chang, P. J. Nair, D. Lee, S. Ghose, M. K. Qureshi, O. Mutlu

Authors: A. Shafiee, A. Nag, N. Muralimanohar, et al.
Name: ISAAC

Paper: Pinatubo: A Processing-in-Memory Architecture for Bulk Bitwise Opera- tions in Emerging Non-Volatile Memories
Methodology: S-DRAM parameters scaled from existing work. Pinatubo parameters from HSPICE and synthesis tool. Modified NVsim for NVM circuit modeling, CACTI-3DD for main memory modeling. (Modified) PIN-based simulator Sniper for SIMD processor and NVM-based system. In-house simulator for AC-PIM, S-DRAM, Pinatubo.

Name: Chameleon

Paper: HRL: Efficient and Flexible Reconfigurable Logic for Near-Data Processing
Methodology: Simulate system performance using zsim extended with detailed DDRx memory model validated with DRAMSim2. Model FPGA arrays using Xilinx Virtex6, power numbers from Xilinx Power Estimator (XPE). Synthesize with Synopsys compiler. Calculate memory power using Micron DRAM power calculator. Programmable cores modeled with McPAT, scratchpad buffers and output queues with CACTI 6.5, routers and interconnect with Orion 2.0, DMA and load/store units with Syopsys IP blocks
Tools: CACTI 6.5, DRAMSim2, FPGA/Synthesis, McPAT, Micron DRAM Power Calculator, Orion, Xilinx, ZSim
Authors: M. Gao, C. Kozyrakis
